Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [pacing back and forth.] No, no, no, no, no, no, no! No, no, no, no, no, no.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay fine. Ryan, something the matter?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Smokey's dead.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Smokey, the bear?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Smokey Robinson Pam. He died like an hour ago, I guess I'm the first to know.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow That's terrible, I really liked him.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Oh you liked him? That's nice. Did you like when he changed the course of American music like two or three times? Did you like that tracks of my tears is maybe the last true love song ever written? I'm glad you liked him Jim. I am completely devastated right now.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, I second that emotion.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Huh?

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: I know a few of his songs, but what were his big ones?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Oh God, Nellie! What wasn't his? I mean, um, "Tracks of my Tears"?

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Yeah

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Um... God, so many, Nellie!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, no, no, "Tracks of My Tears" and what else? What are some more? What's one more?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Okay, I'm not... I'm not playing this game, Pam. Not today.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't think you love Smokey Robinson. I think you're just doing all of this to prove how deep you are about music

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Okay, I'm sorry I'm not a fan of Jason Mraz or the Beatles.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You don't like the Beatles?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: That's... That's not the point!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Eleanor Rigby? Paperback writer?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Okay, you know, you always think you have time to see these legends before they go. What was I so busy doing?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: It says here this Smokey Robinson dead thing was a hoax. It's on CNN as of two minutes ago.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Okay well, that's a relief!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow! Look at that! It says he's actually playing State College. That's only three hours away!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh my God, Ryan! That's perfect! You have to go!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Tickets are 250 bucks.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: 250 dollars is nothing to the world's biggest Smokey Robinson fan.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah... Who's opening?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Paul Anka.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Paul Anka?! How can they make the Smoke Man play with someone like that? I don't think I can see this.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, you could just show up late though.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: How much is parking, like 30 bucks? That's not what Smokey would have wanted. Does want.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Tears of a clown!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Don't call me a clown, Pam. You're better than that!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Looking good, RC!

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Ugh, I hate ties! I feel like I'm being strangled like I'm at some erotic asphyxiation sex club over on I-84. The red room say? Or Dominick's?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Robert! The senator was going to wear dark brown tonight... I'm sure it will be fine.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: My husband is sponsoring a fundraiser tonight for local dog shelters! Robert California bought two tables for everyone here! These people were lucky to get seats because it is going to be a who's who of the northern 22nd district!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I don't want to alarm people, but there is a distinct chance that we are all about to be killed

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, as long as you don't want to alarm people...

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: What's going on?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: There is a disgruntled ex-employee sitting in his car in the parking lot.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh that's Andy. He's just hanging out

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's how workplace tragedies always begin. A middle aged white male "hanging out". Call the cops!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Dwight, I don't think he's going to hurt anybody.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: How do you? I mean, why do you think he's there?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I don't even know what kind of weapon he has. Could be a knife, could be a gun. Could be a series of guns all lined up to shoot parallel. I'm going up to the roof. [Grabs bag.] And I'm gonna bring my gym bag just in case.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: I knew this would happen! Everybody told me if I moved to America, I'd be murdered.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Hey, just wanted to say hi and hear you say everything is normal. Maybe video tape you saying that so that everyone upstairs can see.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: We think you might kill Robert.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: because he fired you which means apparently you're living in your car now.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: guys, everything is fine! I'm just here to pick up Erin. We're going to the Fundraiser.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, great! That sounds good!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Wait, what? You're going to the fundraiser tonight? That's going to be weird.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Why would that be weird?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: It's going to be super weird, he just fired you last week.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Andy's just coming as my date.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Hey, I hear you! I hope you're right. It just seems like it's going to be really, really weird.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: [hears knocks on door.] Come in!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: You really re-did Andy's office, huh?

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Yes, cut out the clutter. Very simple, very minimal.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I need you to sign these, we got a shipment going out.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: How are things in the warehouse?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: You could go downstairs and ask them?

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: The warehouse isn't downstairs? [laughs.] Is it? Is it?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Who knew, right?

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: [speechless.] I...

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Tonight could be the night that Darryl and I go from casual work friends to actual good friends. The only thing standing in our way is the contempt he seems to feel for me.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Robert, the senator and I wanted to stop by and say hello.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hello! Did anyone order a blast from the past, with a side order of sexy?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oh man, this is weird!

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Andrew. [Robert extends his hand.]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, Wanna shake my hand, huh? Cause I want to shake your body! [hugs Robert and laughs.] I had you, I had you!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [points back and forth at the multiple cameras] Where do I look? It's been so long since I did one of these things? Okay, alright! What's the question? How am I doing? Umm... Great!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Creed, I just bid twenty dollars on six Jiu-Jitsu lessons. No one's raping this guy!

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Well, I don't want to get raped [picks up clipboard] Twenty-Two!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: No! It was my idea to not be raped!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [Dwight enters] Wait, you think Jiu-Jitsu classes cost $22 [grabs clipboard.] If you're going to guess the price, you might as well try to be halfway accurate. $180!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Whoa, Dwight, I don't think you understand.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You guess the price, you win the prize. Have you never been to a Quaker fair before? God!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: So Dwight doesn't understand silent auctions. I guess he's the stupid guy in the office, huh? Up till now, we didn't have one!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What haven't I been doing? Gosh, just today I was working on this rock opera that I'm writing, though it feels more like I'm receiving it than writing it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow, that's exciting! But until you firm up the idea, you might want to keep it between us.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: The hero lives in this dystopian future and he flies around in a spaceship that's shaped like a treble clef. And he has to sing his heart out to destroy all evil.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Sounds like you're doing alright.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ehh, a little better than alright, actually. Really good!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Oh, this guy is having a breakdown.

Quote.Speaker: Senator
Quote.Text: You know, Oscar, I really had no idea you were so passionate about animals.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: my dog Gerald is my life.

Quote.Speaker: Senator
Quote.Text: really? Well, if you want to get involved, call me. This is my cell. I'm more likely to pick up night, say after 9... Excuse me. [Walks away.]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: This confirms three things: I'm right about the senator, I still got it, and poor Angela.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: [telling story to Nellie.] I stepped in right away and start-

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Bobby! Bobbo! You're a rock opera guy, right? You like rock operas?

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Well...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You gotta check out this thing I'm working on, it's really cool. There's this character Thomas Oregon, and he wants to destroy all the guitars in the world because he realizes that music is the one thing he can't control.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: So, Thomas Oregon is an evil figure?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Evil! [chuckles.] although he's humanized in the end because he weeps uncontrolably and pees in his pants.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: and the hero, who's that based on?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Me, I guess. [sings.] We're flying so high, we're crackin' the sky! Gonna fly out of this dome my girlfriend and I!

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Hey jabroni. Show some class.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: She's right, Andy. you're being a jabroni

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You're being a Thomas Oregon!

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Andrew, I think this may have been a bad idea. Why don't you let me pay for you and Erin to go out to a great romantic dinner tonight?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Don't need you to pay for me. I'm doing just fine, thank you. Why don't you quit harshing our mellow?

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Andy you should leave. Now.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [to Waiter.] Excuse me. I would like to purchase two seats at another table, please.

Quote.Speaker: Waiter
Quote.Text: I'm sorry, the tables are sold as complete units.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: then I'll take a table!

Quote.Speaker: Waiter
Quote.Text: Okay

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: And a high five! [Raises hand, misses high five with waiter.] Oh, let's do this again!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [waiter is cracking pepper into Andys salad] Oh, yes indeed... When! [Waiter begins walking away.] Whoa, whoa, whoa! You forgot a few salads! [waiter peppers another salad.] When!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I stumbled into a very dramatic situation. Angelas husband just hit on me!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh my god!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I know!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wait, what? Come on!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: We were talking about animals, he gives me his cell phone number. He was just dying for me to have it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, Oscar, I'm not saying you're not dreamy, because you are, but isn't it possible that he was just schmoosing a voter?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Well, if you would have seen the look he gave me, he wanted to run more than just my vote.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, what was this look? [Oscar does the look.]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Whoa!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What happened, did he do it?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Are you- Twice! For real?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay guys, not every glance means something, alright? Life isn't Downton Abbey.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Life is Downton Abbey.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Here's what I'm going to do. I'm going to go over there and I'm going to talk to him and I guarantee you he gives out his cell phone to everybody.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [on phone.] How much do you guys charge for a one full year gym membership? Thank you!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's $475! Like candy from a baby!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey... David Wallace!

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Andy Bernard!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey, how are you?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: How you doing, I'm great! How you doing, are you still with Dunder Mifflin?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No, got canned last week.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Oh, I'm sorry to hear that.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No, best thing that ever happened to me.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: That's the attitude to have. You know what, when I got canned, I was lost, right? I poured myself into this ridiculous vacuum for toys called Suck-It.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yikes!

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Yeah, exactly right? Then suddenly out of nowhere, the US military bought the patent from me for twenty million dollars! The point is, forget those guys, k? Move on! Good to see you, Andy!

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Call me a lame man, but I wish there was some real food here. You know, like hamburgers... Or Oreos... Or a pizza pie or, what's another food that we like?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Tacos.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: What I wouldn't give for a big mess of tacos right now!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I can go get us some tacos.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Brilliant!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: If you loan me some money.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Yes, I can do that. For, um, for two tacos, we'd probably need about what 20... $20? Or $25? $20?

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: I've never eaten a taco. I'm not entirely sure what they are. As long as they're not slimy, and please god don't let them have eyes!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [Jim shakes Senators hand, returns to table.] So?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Boom! [hands Oscar a business card.]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: This is interesting.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: what is interesting? I just proved that he gives his cell out to everybody.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Or you proved that he thinks you're gay.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: He does not think Jim's gay. A gay man would not leave the house wearing those shoes.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, a gay man would not leave the store wearing those shoes!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, hey! you bought me those shoes!

Quote.Speaker: Speaker
Quote.Text: Before we bring out our guest of honor tonight, we are very proud to introduce a great philanthropist and a great guy. Robert California!

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Thank you. Why do we love dogs? Want me to tell you why? There is no answer. Our love for them confounds reason!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: can you believe this guy?

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: The state senator, Robert Lipton, loves dogs. he asked me if I loved dogs. you know what I said? Yes! [laughter.]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Not a joke. That was not even a joke.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Bella here was a therapy dog for ten years. when her owner passed away she came to this organization for placement. But people don't often adopt older dogs, so Bella and eleven heroes like her are being cared for by our generous volunteers because frankly nobody else will

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I will! I will take all of those dogs!

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Andy, that's very kind-

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No, no, no. This guy can talk and talk all he wants, but it's not that complicated.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Andy why don't we discuss this at a-

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No, no, no, it's about being there for someone after it's become inconvenient for them to be around. Hello everyone, I am Andy Bernard and I am going to take that bitch home! That is a female dog reference. [Points at himself] This bitch understands loyalty! Sassy human reference [grabs dog] thank you, I will take Bella and every single one of her friends!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh God!

Quote.Speaker: Senator
Quote.Text: Mr. Bernard, right this way.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Okay! Hope you all learned something!

Quote.Speaker: Vet
Quote.Text: Huey is going to need this medication once every 90 minutes. You can administer it orally, but he's going to puke it up. So, other end is best. Don't split up Daisy and Mojo because daisy will start to, uh... I was going to say bark, but it's more of a scream.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'm so ready to love all of these animals. This one's even bonding with me already.

Quote.Speaker: Vet
Quote.Text: Uh, no. Kenny's a therapy dog. He apparently thinks you're in some kind of emotional crisis.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Stupid dog.

Quote.Speaker: Senator
Quote.Text: Well, if you would like to talk about this some more, my office is always open! So here's my office number, and my cell number.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Thank you!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, looks like he really did just want to talk about the issues. i'm Sorry Oscar.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: sorry about what? There's nothing to be sorry about here.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: No. I'm certainly not disappointed that Angelas husband was not hitting on me. I'd have to be a monster to root for that. A lonely, aging monster.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Tacos were on sale, eight for $3!

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Oh, great! Okay, oh... Oh, these tacos!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Hmhmm.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Mmm! Uhh [Eats Taco incorrectly.] Mmmm... Oh! Hmmph!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: She's trying.

Quote.Speaker: Speaker
Quote.Text: The winner of the three day trip to the sky top lodge is Dwight Schrute!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [applause] Yes! Thank you!

Quote.Speaker: Speaker
Quote.Text: The yearlong membership to Scraton-Bikram Yoga is Dwight Schrute!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [applause] Oh yes! Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Speaker
Quote.Text: A one hour appointment with the kissing magician goes to Dwight Schrute!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [applause] Oh, oh, oh! Yeah! Ha, ha!

Quote.Speaker: Speaker
Quote.Text: Well, I think I can save us some time, Dwight Schrute has won every single item here!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Thank you very much! All I had to do was look at the prices, idiots! Suck it!

Quote.Speaker: Speaker
Quote.Text: Well, Dwight, yes! You certainly are a record breaker! Your donation is the largest we've ever received at over 34 thousand dollars! [applause]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Speech! Speech! Speech! Speech!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Thank you. Wow, I can't tell you what an honor it is to support this thing... And obviously that amount of money is no concern to me whatsoever. But, I want to ask you something: when did it become all about the money. when did it become about the flower arrangements, and the white wine spritser, hmm? and all the dinner rolls. you people should be ashamed of yourselves! How many courses did we have tonight, two? Three maybe, if you choose the pudding? I mean what waste! these tables tarted up like Victorian whores! lets' remember we are all here for the dog society. He's what's important, whatever his name is. Not any of this. So that is going to be my donation to you. Thank you and good night! [throws microphone and runs away]

Quote.Speaker: Senator
Quote.Text: Oscar!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Nice to see you again, it was lovely!

Quote.Speaker: Senator
Quote.Text: It was lovely! And don't forget to call.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: okay

Quote.Speaker: Senator
Quote.Text: thanks so much for coming

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: why does this always happen to me? Ahh! I just feel so bad for Angela

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [applying diaper to dog.] so it just goes on under here like this?

Quote.Speaker: Vet
Quote.Text: that's right!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ugh, oh god!

Quote.Speaker: Vet
Quote.Text: Yeah, you never get used to that.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, just wanted to check in. See how you are doing.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I am so great!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: He's great. we're all great. Twelve dogs. This my life now, I'm a dog nurse.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Look at that one though, he's smiling!

Quote.Speaker: Vet
Quote.Text: Yeah, he should be! It's his first day without a muzzle.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: This is the greatest thing that has ever happened to me

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Absolutely, it's awesome-

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes-

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I'm sorry, are you guys nuts? He's not doing great! He was fired! This is terrible! This is literally the worst thing that has ever happened to you, not the best.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You're right. he's right, I am a mess. This whole night I've been trying to convince you guys that I'm fine. I guess I thought that if I could convince you that I'm fine, maybe-

Quote.Speaker: Vet
Quote.Text: Maybe you would think it too! [silence.] I'm sorry, it's just I don't get to be in a lot of human conversations.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay well, Andy, listen. It's okay if you don't feel totally settled. This is all very fresh.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, I mean, admitting you need help is the first step!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yes! And also, focusing on the positive. Like I got a lot of good things going on!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah! Like that rock opera! You could always do that right?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, I do. I have that.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: You're going to be alright

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: No. No he's not.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yes, I am! Thank you, Kev!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: You're welcome!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Sometimes I feel like every one I work with is an idiot. and by sometimes I mean all times. All the times. Every of the times!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: So some of us ended up adopting those elderly dogs. It's been great!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Pepper's been getting me out of the house, going on runs.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: My dog Ruby doesn't do anything, she just lays there all day! She's so chill.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What do you feed her?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Well I put out Pro Bow-Wow, but she barely touches it. She's so dainty!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Is she sick? How are her poops?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Doesn't really poop. It's perfect, nothing to pick up! She just kind of lies there all day like a good girl. I put on the TV for her, but I have to prop her eyes open so she can see it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Does she smell?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: She smells horrible. It's unbelievable. But I don't want to put her in the bath, because I'm afraid that she'll drown.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: People seem awful interested in you Ruby. Guess they're just jealous, right! [dog licks Kevins face.] Yeah, that a girl, that a girl! Man that stinks!
